message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a Bayesian approach to recurrence in neural networks, which is a topic that falls under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), natural language processing (cs.CL), and computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV). Given that the paper focuses on the architecture of neural networks and their performance in speech recognition, it is most likely to belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG, cs.AI, and cs.NE. However, since the paper also discusses the use of context indicators and probabilistic input gates, it could also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.CL and cs.CV.
